snippet: Matt Adamczyk, Wisconsin’s newly elected Republican treasurer, is so committed to cutting needless expenses that he has promised to eliminate his own office.
abstract: Republican Matt Adamczyk, newly elected Wisconsin state treasurer, loses little time in attempting to fulfill his campaign promise of cutting down on government waste, including eliminating his own job; move requires a constitutional amendment, and in meantime Adamczyk's aggressive oversight of Board of Commissioners of Public Lands has some wondering if his motives go beyond rooting out waste.
lead_paragraph: Matt Adamczyk, Wisconsin’s newly elected Republican treasurer, is so committed to cutting needless expenses that he has promised to eliminate his own office.

headline.main: Wisconsin’s Treasurer Wants to Cut Needless Workers, Starting With Himself
headline.print_headline: Wisconsin’s Treasurer Wants to Cut Needless Workers, Starting With Himself
